revised_title: Motion and Structure of Shock Waves in a Self-Gravitating Gas Sphere
tldr: This paper presents a general method to describe the motion of shock waves of varying strength in a self-gravitating gas sphere. The authors focus on the effects of varying the index and the ratio of specific heats of the gas. They provide a detailed example of a density distribution and demonstrate the impact of the index on the motion and structure of the shock wave.
